examples.functionFinder
Class FormulaFinder

java.lang.Object
  examples.functionFinder.FormulaFinder

public class FormulaFinder
extends java.lang.Object

Function Finder example - Main class.

The function finder tries to find a formula that matches best a given table of input/output-value pairs (X,Y values). Meaning: Minimize the error for all given inputs X over the corresponding output Y.

Refactored solution of ther example provided with JGAP 2.2. Now uses the newly introduced TruthTableFitnessFunction.

Since:
2.4

Field Detail

MAX_TERMS_IN_FUNCTION

public static final int MAX_TERMS_IN_FUNCTION
Maximum number of allowed terms in formula to be evolved. Example: MAX_TERMS_IN_FUNCTION = 1 --> F(X) = sin(X) MAX_TERMS_IN_FUNCTION = 2 --> F(X) = sin(X*cos(X)) = 2 --> F(X) = sin(X*cos(abs(X)+3)) ...
